intro: Calcitrapa aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian calcitrapa, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Mediterranean and Middle East. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to greenish flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are often finely divided, and the plant is adapted to survive in dry, sandy soils. Calcitrapa aegyptiaca is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
